summary: An ENB preset for those who want the feeling of being in Skyrim. Install set your in-game brightness and your all set! Can't wait for Special Edition!!!
descriptionHtml:
[center][youtube]73LK3Rh6bpE[/youtube]
This videos thumbnail is very wrongly colored lol! A little over-happy. This is of ver.1 with URWL and Relighting Skyrim.


[color=rgb(152,0,0)][size=5][b][color=#980000]VERSION 2
is
FINISHED![/color]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75324-0-1465945714.jpg[/img]
[color=#980000][size=1][color=#000000]Right Click and select view image[/color]

[/size][/color][/b][/size][/color][b][color=rgb(152,0,0)][size=3][color=#980000]Requires only NLVW or similar weather plugin, and Relighting Skyrim.ENB Ver. 0.305 and up.
CoT V or later should be fine.
Claralux is fine.[/color]
[b][color=#980000]Don't use the bright days better rain patch on Ver.2
Features DoF from Soulwynd

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75324-6-1465947587.jpg[/img]
[/color][/b][/size][/color][/b][b][color=rgb(152,0,0)][color=#000000][size=1][color=rgb(152,0,0)][size=5][b][color=#980000][size=1][color=#000000]Right Click and select view image[/color][/size][/color][/b][/size][/color][/size][/color]

[color=#980000]RECOMMENDED:
Ethereal Clouds
Realistic Water TWO
[b]Tamriel RELOADED HD without trees and grass or with but not compatible with other tree and grass mods.[/b]
Better Land-More Vanilla version or Enhanced Land
SFO
Verdant 1.6b
REALISTIC HD food, beverages, and almost all of the series
Realistic mass and materials
Macom's Real skin for men
UNP with BAIN
Realistic primitive Ponies (name check)
Animalica Vanilla friendly version
WET and COLD and W+C Ashes
and if you feel like digging....
Skyrim Realistic Overhaul (Textures) banned from Nexus
and
SG Hair pack AIO (hair for females) banned also both look great though.

[/color][b][color=#980000]Also, make sure to setup your enb local files correctly as they are different for each PC
mine is set for a machine with 8gb RAM and 2gb VRAM on Windows 10 for example. I use really high quality textures where I can but reduced to 2k through Texture Optimizer allowing me to have great quality and frame-rate. All my textures are 2k and very few are lower. So, if your rig can run 4-8K textures without lag this preset will look better than my screenshots on your PC especially if you setup your enb local properly.
[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75324-8-1465946894.jpg[/img][/color][/b]

[size=3][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75324-2-1465945713.jpg[/img][/size]
[size=3][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75324-0-1465947588.jpg[/img][/size]
[size=3][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75324-0-1465946895.jpg[/img][/size]
[color=#980000][size=3]Night is dark but not unmanageable on most monitors.[/size]

[size=3]Note: I use a SONY BRAVIA 60" so I use a High Quality Monitor. I use close to max. backlight. [/size]
[size=6]If you have trouble seeing
turn the brightness up.[/size]
[/color][size=3]Monitor, ENB, Skyrim options try them all to see which is best.[/size]
[/color][/b][/center]A ENB preset that focuses on realism, balance and immersion. FPS are around 50+ with the main setup and as low as 40 with all effects active ( with dips in both scenarios depending on the area ). Stuttering is rare and almost never happens. Feel like your there in Tamriel with a real-life like atmosphere. Pictures really don't do this preset justice, playing is allot better than looking at my pictures.
A Dynamic 24-hr Preset that is compatible with anything I can think of and has full Time of Day settings. Lore friendly so that it enhances lighting and weather mods instead of burying them.
All effects are there, but it starts out with natural and realistic type of setting. If you want an effect put a check by it and it's there (preset) I don't recommend Image Based Lighting though. Anyway, the Fantasy effects are there for your choosing.

[color=#980000]Install[/color]: Delete all old Enb preset first, or use an enb manager. Basically, Delete all old enb files and paste this in skyrim directory. First time users should go to the [url=http://enbdev.com/download.htm]ENB site [/url]for proper setup information. It's not hard I just know that fewer mistakes come when viewing the direct source. Download the latest ENB binary for Skyrim.

Recommended: Preset looks best IMO with CoT V with cold interiors, and hardcore dungeons, Realistic Nights with darkest option, and Relighting Skyrim. Or NLA plugin, with Realistic Nights with darkest option, and Relighting Skyrim.
Parallax textures are nice too. Realistic Water Two for example. It will still look great on the Vanilla game as well.
 
I'm only posting a few pictures now in hopes that people will post some of there own. It's boring to only see author pictures do you agree.
Besides there are a great many better at screenarchery than I.

Actions: I added 15 weather pictures using URWL at the same time of day while in Riverwood.
Uploading a small video.

Added 6 pictures of CoT and CoT Hardcore Dungeons with Realistic nights both on darkest settings. Also, some pictures of what mods I'm using and load order I have them in.

Added 4 more pictures to CoT examples.

Tested working on NLA plugin. Plugin only with or without realistic nights plugin. looks better with realistic nights imo.

Finally added 24 NLA plugin photos from first picture on the left going toward the left ( backwards ). Stopping on the load order screenshots.

NLVW plugin looks so good. Just follow instructions on [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75346/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D75346&pUp=1]NLVA[/url] page for plugin installation.

Ver.2 made and lots of pictures put up

Note: Almost all of my pictures are taken with the start-up (like putting no checks by an enb effect in the enb gui) version of this ENB, with the exception of turning on DoF rarely. The idea is to show you the raw natural feel of the shading and colors without the distraction of all the blur.

Credits:
Bethesda,
Boris for ENB,
CeeJay.dk,
Zeroking,
SkyrimTuner,
[color=#980000]Soulwynd for the DoF on Ver.2[/color]
Extensive Sunsprite Shader
Code modifications by KYO aka Oyama w/some help from Boris ;)
Sunglare Technique Vertex Codes by Matso
Initial Lens Distortion Code by IceLaGlace
Sunglare and Lens Textures by --JawZ--
All of these people wrote the files that made this happen and did all the true hard work.

Any donations I would have received if I had put up a Donation button should go to Blacktree Gaming, and the Authors I listed above. They deserve it.

[center][/center][center]The inspiration for this preset and preset name: Makes me want to play Skyrim!

[youtube]h6-krHfdmGg[/youtube][/center]
author: JaredCapps
